Medicine_tweet_59_r$Medicine_403_p$Medic.text:
Finding A: In our latest @username funded study in @username, people with severe obesity & diabetes who had bariatric surgery were associated with 40% lower 5-year risk of heart attack and stroke than matched people who got usual medical care
Finding B: In this study, not one child met strict diagnostic criteria for ASD using results of both the ADOS and SCQ.
Finding C: For instance, more than one in three care home staff were rarely aware of a resident being taken outside of the home for their enjoyment, and 15% said activities were almost never planned around a resident\'s interests.
Finding D: In conclusion, our findings support the importance of frailty in late-life health etiology.

Finding C: For instance, more than one in three care home staff were rarely aware of a resident being taken outside of the home for their enjoyment, and 15% said activities were almost never planned around a resident\'s interests.

Medicine_418_r$Medicine_217_p$Medicine_2.text:
Finding A: A new study on dog behavior may help us better understand how human personalities affect obesity.
Finding B: The incidence rate of type 1 diabetes was lower in the non-EV than the EV group (4 vs 6 per 100,000 person-years; incidence rate ratio 1.48 [95% CI 1.19, 1.83]) ( Table 2 ).

Finding D: In other words, it isn\'t testosterone levels that predict muscle gains, but how sensitive your muscles are to that testosterone.
